topics.body:
You know I thought of something random; considering how popular anthropomorphics is anthros and etc would be able to go mainstream if it weren't for how fans of anthropomorphism almost seem as though they don't want it to become popular.

What I mean by this is that there exists in many fanbases of popular genres, movies and such individuals who relish in underground subcultures for the sake of belonging to a underground subculture as a counterculture; aka the hipster mentality of believing anything that is mainstream is "trash" or such and actively engage in behavior that is counterculture for the sake of trying to further themselves from mainstream culture.  Basically what I mean by this is that with any fanbase there exists individuals who intentionally act as satires of the stereotypes as a means of trying to differentiate themselves from mainstream culture.
tl:dr; every fanbase has tryhard hipsters who act like idiots to prove they're most underground.


Anyways; my point is that thinking on things why are bronies mainstream whereas groups like furries aren't?  Easy; cause particular fanbases like furries don't want to go mainstream cause they believe mainstream = automatically bad in much the same way gen1 mlp fans hate FIM so a lot of the idiotic behavior theoretically is intentional.


Tl:dr; maybe the reason why some fandoms remain underground whereas other fandoms are mainstream is because some fandoms hate the idea of going mainstream and want to be underground instead?
